name: Paces
headline: Siting and Due Diligence of Green Projects
description:
In the next 30 years, the world will transform every part of the built environment to be climate positive green infrastructure. Knowing what, where, and how to build infrastructure like solar farms and data centers is one of the great opportunities of our time.

Paces is software for green infrastructure developers to identify the best places to build and manage their projects. Our software supports renewable energy, EV charging, carbon sequestration and data center customers with interconnection, permitting and siting of their projects.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:saas; industry:proptech; industry:climate; industry:energy; location:new-york

founders.name: James McWalter, Founder
founders.description: I’m the co-founder and CEO of Paces. Originally from Ireland, previously I was the founder of Hale, a personal training marketplace and held senior roles at Google acquired ML startup Hello Vera, B2B marketplace Respondent and fintech giant FactSet.

founders.name: Charles Bai, Founder
founders.description: Charles is the co-founder and CTO of Paces. Before Paces, Charles led the AI efficiency effort at Facebook AI, where he worked on large model inferences and designed and built metrics to track the power/carbon cost of AI models. Before that, he worked at a few different startups and built multiple data-intensive software solutions. Charles grew up in Beijing and holds a CS degree from Cornell.

## What if you could start your development strategy with high potential markets and de-risked sites?
[Book Call](https://paces.com/<#>)
Development teams waste hours verifying data, checking for environmental flags, and conducting manual reviews.As a development team, you’re constantly balancing the tradeoff:‍- How much time do you spend de-risking upfront before engaging landowners? - How much risk do you accept to move faster, only to encounter issues later?Imagine if your team never had to make that tradeoff.
## Stop wasting time on work that can be automated. Develop pipeline faster and deploy more projects.
With Paces, every risk is flagged and analyzed upfront—automatically. Your team walks into a market armed with all the critical insights, ready to engage landowners, and secure site control faster than ever before.
[Read More](https://paces.com/<http:/www.paces.com/post/introducing-the-accelerated-development-framework>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64135037318ac2d9769f6211/67a13146430d160e83b2c6d6_Frame%201650.png)
Market Suitability
Identify the best markets for your unique strategy with tailored recommendations and in-depth analysis of over 155 million sites.
Site Selection & Ranking
Access pre-vetted, risk-assessed sites in your target market with multi-dimensional data for faster, smarter decisions.
Development Support
Customized solutions, data verification, and risk assessment to ensure you get your best projects in front of the right partners.
[Book Call](https://paces.com/<#>)
## Unlock Faster Decisions and Smarter Investments
Boost Your Revenue
Cut Development Time in Half
Lower Costs by 50%
Maximize Megawatts per Head
[Ready to scale your development pipeline?](https://paces.com/<#>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/64135037318ac2d9769f6211/679b9965944d1d14c60d8b0e_mohit-kumar-inuKuQiLL5M-unsplash%202.jpg)
## Delivering the Fastest Path to Renewable Energy Deployment
Every project has unique challenges—whether you're a power developer looking to accelerate site origination or data center developer that needs to secure reliable, future-ready locations. Paces gives you the data, insights, and confidence to move forward faster.Ready to talk? [Book a call now.](https://paces.com/<#>)

[Learn More](https://paces.com/</power-developers>)
For Data Center Developers
Lock in viable sites and secure power before the competition
[Learn More](https://paces.com/</load-projects>)

Stay up to date on Paces product updates and industry insights.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Paces**

Founded in 2022 and based in New York, Paces is a forward-thinking company poised to capitalize on the green infrastructure revolution. The firm emerged from Y Combinator's S22 batch and has gathered a team of 30 dedicated employees, under the guidance of Group Partner Nicolas Dessaigne. 

**Mission Statement:**
Paces aims to facilitate the siting and due diligence of green projects, enhancing how developers approach renewable energy, EV charging, carbon sequestration, and data centers. The company's belief is simple yet profound: in the next three decades, every aspect of the built environment will need to transition towards climate-positive infrastructure. With such a massive shift on the horizon, knowing where and how to build these projects is a tremendous opportunity.

**What They Do:**
Paces offers innovative software tailored specifically for green infrastructure developers. Their solutions simplify the complex tasks surrounding project development by automating the identification of optimal sites, managing interconnections, and navigating permitting requirements. Essentially, they remove the tedious legwork that typically bogs down development teams, allowing them to focus more on execution rather than paperwork. 

**Key Features:**
1. **Market Suitability**: Analyze over 155 million sites to find the best markets for specific strategic needs.
2. **Site Selection & Ranking**: Access a database of pre-vetted, risk-assessed sites to make informed decisions faster.
3. **Development Support**: Provides customized solutions and risk assessments to enhance project success rates.

**Current Initiatives:**
Paces actively publishes insights, including the latest edition of the Renewable Energy Trends report, which offers data-driven guidance on solar site selection. They also offer resources like case studies, blogs, and podcasts to keep their customers informed and engaged.

**Impact and Goals:**
By enabling developers to make informed decisions quickly and efficiently, Paces aims to reduce development time and costs significantly—potentially by as much as 50%. Their ultimate goal is to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy projects and empower businesses to build sustainable solutions for the future.

**Explore More:**
For more information, you can visit their website at [paces.com](https://paces.com), where they offer various resources and opportunities to engage directly with their team.

In a world where we're racing against climate change, Paces positions itself as a crucial ally for those daring enough to innovate in the green infrastructure space. If you’re part of this frontier, it might be worth checking them out.
